column1: # This file is a template to create a profile by importing it on the NurseScheduler web application.
# A profile starts with the keyword profile
column2: all the lines before this keywork will not be considered.
use the keyword shifts on a seperate line before defining the shifts.

column1: # Each shift is defined on a seperate line and it consists of the shift's name
column2: the shift's start time and the shift's end time

column1: # To start defining the shift types
column2: use the keyword shift types on a seperate line.

column1: # Each shift type is defined on a seperate line and it consists of the shift type name followed by the shifts list
# To start defining the shift groups
column2: use the keyword shift groups on a seperate line.

column1: # Each shift group is defined on a seperate line and it consists of the shift group name followed by the shifts list and the shift types list

column2: use the keyword contracts on a seperate line.

column1: # Each contract begins with the contract name followed by the constraints list.
# Each constraint is defined on a line which starts with the constraint name.
# Eleven types of constraints are supported by the application.
# unwanted patterns which is consisted of a list of pattern elements followed by a weight or a penalty for not respecting the constraint.
# The definition of a pattern element consists of a list of days seperated by | followed by a list of shifts seperated by |
# You can use the example in this template to create your custom imported profile.
total number of working weekends in four weeks
number of free days after shift
minimum and maximum of consecutive shift type
minimum and maximum of working hours in four weeks
minimum and maximum of consecutive working weekends
minimum and maximum number of assignments in four weeks
minimum and maximum of consecutive shift type
